Description: Small pottery lekythos, part of rim missing. Clay cream, coarse with fine grits. Cylindrical body, flattened shoulder, long tubular neck, base flat, rough, with wire marks. Tiny crude handle from base of neck to shoulder. Undecorated.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Crude derivative of type of Royal Ontario Museum 910.143.1 (Hayes 1992, 168 no. 212)
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 168, no. 214)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.19)
